Class TUI

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.View.TUI.TUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
View
public class TUI extends Object implements View
The TUI class represents a text-based user interface for interacting with the game system. It handles various in-game events, manages game state representations, and provides methods for formatting and displaying information to the player during the game. This class implements the necessary methods to respond to events and user interactions. It extends the View class and provides a concrete implementation for text-based interactions.

    Constructs a TUI (Textual User Interface) instance for the game, facilitating interactions between the user and the game state.

  • Constructor Details

    • TUI

      public TUI()
      A constructor for the TUI (Text User Interface) class. This method initializes a new instance of the TUI class. It is used to set up the necessary fields or configurations required for the proper functioning of the text-based user interface. This constructor does not accept any parameters.

    • TUI

      public TUI(LoginClient loginClient) throws IOException
      Constructs a TUI (Textual User Interface) instance for the game, facilitating interactions between the user and the game state. Initializes various components such as input reader, game board, cache structures, and client handlers.
      Parameters:
      loginClient - The initial login client which manages the login state and primary actions such as joining a lobby, creating a game, or reconnecting.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading component names or initializing other settings.

      Specified by:
      setGameboard in interface View
      Parameters:
      lv - the level of the gameboard to set up; determines the gameboard structure and positions.

    • showLobby

      public void showLobby(LobbyEvent event)
      Updates and displays the game lobby based on the provided lobby event. This method processes the given event to update the lobby state, such as adding a new lobby entry or removing an existing one. It initializes the lobby client state if this is the first update and triggers any required game state updates.
      Specified by:
      showLobby in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the LobbyEvent containing information about the lobby to be displayed. The event holds details such as the game ID, level (lv), and associated players.

      Specified by:
      showLobbyGame in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the GameLobbyEvent containing the list of players and their readiness statuses to be used for updating the lobby game state.

    • phaseChanged

      public void phaseChanged(PhaseEvent event)
      Handles phase change events in the game. This method is triggered whenever a phase change occurs. It updates the player's state, clears output if specific conditions are met, configures the auto-completion commands based on the new phase, and triggers a game update process.
      Specified by:
      phaseChanged in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the PhaseEvent containing details about the new phase and player state.

    • updateOthersPB

      public void updateOthersPB(PlayerTileEvent event)
      Updates the player board for other players based on the event details provided. This method processes the event and makes updates to the game state associated with other players' boards.
      Specified by:
      updateOthersPB in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the PlayerTileEvent object containing information about the player's action, including ID, player name, coordinates, and some contextual data.

    • seeBoards

      public void seeBoards()
      Updates the player's state to allow viewing the game boards. This method transitions the player to the "see boards" state if the player's current state is not already set to seeBoardsClient or seeLog. If the state transition occurs, the previous state is stored in the lastState field for potential future reference. After setting the new state to seeBoardsClient, the method triggers a game update using onGameUpdate(). The behavior of the game boards view is determined by the specific implementation of the seeBoardsClient state and any subsequent updates to the game state.
      Specified by:
      seeBoards in interface View

    • refresh

      public void refresh()
      Refreshes the game state by restoring the player's previous state and triggering a game update. This method is used to restore the player's state to the previously stored lastState. Once the state is restored, a game update is triggered by invoking onGameUpdate(). This ensures that the game reflects the updated player state and any associated changes in the game display or internal logic. The restoration logic is dependent on playerClient.setPlayerState(), which sets the state of the player based on the saved lastState. After the state is updated, onGameUpdate() schedules and handles a refreshed view or processing of game details.
      Specified by:
      refresh in interface View

    • effectCard

      public void effectCard(LogEvent event)
      Executes the card effect based on the provided log event. This method processes the log event to extract its message, updates the game log with the extracted message, and triggers the game update functionality.
      Specified by:
      effectCard in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the log event carrying the message that needs to be processed

    • updatePBInfo

      public void updatePBInfo(PBInfoEvent event)
      Updates the player's board information based on the provided event details. This method processes the PBInfoEvent to update the player's board state. It utilizes the `formatPBInfo` helper method to format the event data appropriately and sets the output using the `out` object. Any exceptions encountered during processing are caught and logged.
      Specified by:
      updatePBInfo in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the PBInfoEvent containing the updated player's board information to be processed and displayed.

    • updateHourglass

      public void updateHourglass(HourglassEvent event)
      Updates the hourglass state based on the provided event and triggers a game update. This method processes the specified HourglassEvent by checking its message and start status. It updates the hourglass state in the output and invokes a game update to reflect the changes.
      Specified by:
      updateHourglass in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the HourglassEvent containing the start status and associated message to update the hourglass state.

    • seeLog

      public void seeLog()
      Updates the current state of the player's interface to allow viewing the game log. This method transitions the player's state to `seeLog` if the current state is not already `seeBoardsClient` or `seeLog`. If a state transition occurs, the previous state is stored in the `lastState` field to allow returning to the earlier context if needed. After changing the state, the method triggers an update of the game view by invoking `onGameUpdate()`.
      Specified by:
      seeLog in interface View

    • showOutcome

      public void showOutcome(FinishGameEvent event)
      Displays the outcome of the game based on the provided game event. This method updates the output to reflect the result of the game, sets the player's state to the finish state, and triggers a game update.
      Specified by:
      showOutcome in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the FinishGameEvent containing the result and message details of the finished game. The result indicates whether the player has won or lost, and the message provides additional context or feedback about the outcome.

    • reconnect

      public void reconnect(ReconnectedEvent event)
      Handles the reconnection event for the user interface. This method is invoked when a reconnection occurs. It clears the output related to the lobby and log views to reset the state, ensuring a clean interface state for the user.
      Specified by:
      reconnect in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the ReconnectedEvent containing the details of the reconnection, such as token, game ID, player ID, and level.

    • formatPBInfo

      public String formatPBInfo(PBInfoEvent event)
      Formats the PBInfoEvent into a string representation by composing various components using ASCII art and numerical data from the event.
      Parameters:
      event - the PBInfoEvent containing various metrics such as credits, cargo value, exposed connectors, damage, number of humans, engine power, and plasma drills power to be formatted.
      Returns:
      a formatted string representation of the PBInfoEvent using ASCII art and numeric details.

    • formatCell

      public String[] formatCell(LobbyEvent event)
      Formats a cell representation of a game lobby event into an array of strings.
      Parameters:
      event - the LobbyEvent object containing details of the game lobby, including game ID, level, maximum players, and list of players in the lobby
      Returns:
      an array of strings where each string represents a line in the formatted cell.

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard(TileEvent event)
      Updates the board state based on the specified tile event. This method manages modifications to the cached board and player board, as well as handles specific scenarios based on the event ID and coordinates. Additionally, it processes certain actions when the setup phase is completed.
      Specified by:
      updateBoard in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the TileEvent object containing details about the action to be applied to the board. It includes the coordinates of the action, the event's ID, and other relevant properties. If the event is null, an empty cell is set at the specified location.

      Specified by:
      showMessage in interface View
      Parameters:

    • formatCell

      public String[] formatCell()
      Formats a cell in a game board by generating an array of strings representing each line of the cell. The first and last lines of the array consist of the game board border, while the middle lines contain uniform spacing within borders.
      Returns:
      an array of strings where each string represents a line of a formatted cell

    • formatPosition

      public String[] formatPosition(int k)
      Formats the position of the game board with a specified value and returns the formatted lines.
      Parameters:
      k - the value to be inserted in the formatted position lines
      Returns:
      an array of strings representing the formatted lines of the game board

    • formatCell

      public String[] formatCell(TileEvent event)
      Formats a TileEvent into a visual representation of a cell consisting of an array of strings. Each element of the array represents a line of text illustrating the tile's visual details such as connectors, name, extra information, and coordinates.
      Parameters:
      event - The TileEvent containing information about the tile to be formatted. If the event is null, a default empty representation of the cell will be created.
      Returns:
      A string array where each element represents a line of the formatted cell.

    • stripAnsi

      public static String stripAnsi(String s)
      Removes ANSI escape codes from the given string. ANSI escape codes are used for formatting text with colors or other styles in terminal output.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string that may contain ANSI escape codes
      Returns:
      a new string with all ANSI escape codes removed

    • centerTextAnsi

      public static String centerTextAnsi(String s, int width)
      Centers the given text within the specified width, including ANSI escape sequences. Accounts for the visible length of the text excluding ANSI escape codes when centering.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string, which may contain ANSI escape sequences
      width - the total width within which the text should be centered
      Returns:
      a new string with the text centered, including padding spaces

    • centerTextAnsi

      public static String centerTextAnsi(String s, int width, String c)
      Centers the given text within a specified width while supporting ANSI escape codes. The padding is done with the specified character.
      Parameters:
      s - the text to be centered, which may include ANSI escape codes
      width - the total width within which the text should be centered
      c - the character to use for padding on both sides of the text
      Returns:
      the text centered in the specified width, padded with the given character

    • updateHand

      public void updateHand(HandEvent event)
      Updates the hand based on the provided HandEvent. If the event ID matches a specific value, the hand is cleared. Otherwise, a TileEvent is created and formatted before updating the hand. Finally, a game update is triggered.
      Specified by:
      updateHand in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the HandEvent that contains the details to update the hand, including event ID and connectors.

    • updateGameboard

      public void updateGameboard(GameBoardEvent event)
      Updates the gameboard based on the provided game event. This method adjusts the gameboard representation and player positions based on the given event. If a player is already positioned, it clears their previous position before updating to the new one.
      Specified by:
      updateGameboard in interface View
      Parameters:
      event - the GameBoardEvent containing the position and player information required to update the gameboard.

    • showDeck

      Specified by:
      showDeck in interface View
      Parameters:

    • onGameUpdate

      public void onGameUpdate()
      Handles game update events. This method ensures that any previously scheduled update tasks are canceled and a new task is scheduled with a specified debounce delay. It updates the game state and triggers the display of the game's current status. The method is synchronized to ensure thread safety when dealing with the scheduling of tasks and concurrent updates. Key Behavior: - Cancels any existing scheduled task if it is not already completed. - Schedules a new task after the configured debounce delay. - Attempts to display the current game state when the scheduled task runs. Exceptions: - Any exceptions thrown while showing the game (e.g., by the `out.showGame()` method) are caught and logged via stack trace output.

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shuts down the scheduler, stopping all scheduled tasks and preventing new tasks from being scheduled. This method should be called when the scheduler is no longer needed to release resources and ensure a clean termination.

    • formatRewards

      public StringBuilder formatRewards(RewardsEvent event)
      Formats the rewards from a given event into a structured StringBuilder. The method iterates through the list of goods in the event's rewards, appending a visual representation of each reward based on its value.
      Parameters:
      event - the RewardsEvent containing the list of rewards to be formatted
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder with the formatted visual representation of the rewards

    • formatScoreboard

      public StringBuilder formatScoreboard(HashMap<String,Integer> scoreboard)
      Formats a scoreboard into a structured table-like string with ranks, player names, and scores. Provides a visually appealing representation of the data, including emojis for the top three ranks.
      Parameters:
      scoreboard - a HashMap where the keys are player names (type String) and the values are their scores (type Integer)
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder containing the formatted scoreboard

    • getOut

      public Out getOut()
      Retrieves the current value of the 'out' field.
      Returns:
      the current instance of the Out object.

    • setClient

      public void setClient(Client client)
      Sets the client instance to be used.
      Parameters:
      client - the Client object to set
